description: Add local caching layer for GitHub storage backends
context:
Problem: GitHub storage backends hit the API on every read, which is slow and wasteful.

Solution: Add an optional caching layer that:
- Caches TaskStore locally (in-memory or file)
- Invalidates on write operations
- Has configurable TTL
- Can be disabled for always-fresh data

Implementation ideas:
- Create CachedStorageEngine wrapper class
- Wraps any StorageEngine and adds caching
- Config option: cache_ttl (seconds, 0 to disable)
- For file cache: store in .dex/cache/github-{owner}-{repo}.json
- For memory cache: simple in-memory Map with timestamps

Benefits:
- Faster list/show operations
- Reduced API rate limit usage
- Better offline support

Trade-offs:
- Stale data if external changes happen
- Need cache invalidation strategy
- Additional complexity

Related: GitHub Issues/Projects storage implementations
